text: [Music]
[Music]
hello I'm Adrienne a cloud Support
Engineer at the AWS headquarters in
Seattle sometimes customers ask me how
they can display contact attributes in a
screen pop by using the Amazon connect
streams API I tell them
Amazon Connect is a cloud-based contact
center service that makes it easy for
any business to deliver better customer
service the streams API gives you the
power to integrate existing web
applications with Amazon connect so
today I'll show you how to display a
screen pop let's get started after
logging into your AWS management console
navigate to your Amazon connect instance
by logging in through the access URL
then navigate to the routing drop-down
on the left side of the instance and
select the contact flows option here you
can see all the contact flows in the
instance choose an existing contact flow
or create a new one this contact flow
accepts a customer's zip code performs a
data dip using a lambda function takes
the output from a WS lambda and then
sets it as contact attributes the data
dip to lambda here is optional the first
block is store customer input this is
where we'll ask the customer to enter
their zip code here you can see we're
asking the customer to please enter your
zip code the second block sends the zip
code to a lambda function to perform a
data dip this step is optional enter the
lambda function a RN that you want to
use and then send the attribute taken
from the first block you can see this is
my lambda function a RN and here is
where we're sending the attribute to the
lambda function from the previous store
customer input the third block sets the
attributes as contact attributes so that
the contact information can be accessed
from the streams API the first attribute
is an output from the lambda function
you can ignore this one if you did not
perform a data dip in lambda the second
attribute is the zip code that the
customer entered from the first block
now I will move over to a text editor to
show you the HTML file showing streams
API implementation so as you can see
here I have a very basic HTML page
hosted on Amazon s3 as a static web page
with the streams API script already
implemented there are five different
events that can trigger the screen pop
and my implementation the screen pop is
displayed when the agent is connected to
a customer first retrieve the contact
attributes by calling contact dot get
attributes this returns a JSON object
that needs to be stringify
so that we have two variables
representing the contact attributes
using window alert will display the
contact attributes when an agent is
connected to a customer
now I'm going to open my web application
that is already integrated with Amazon
connect using the streams API let's make
a test call and see what happens when an
agent accept the call I'm going to
accept a call as you can see I've picked
up the call as soon as the agent picks
up we can see the details of the
customer and a screen pop thanks for
watching and happy cloud computing from
all of us here at AWS
[Music]
